intro: Centrostachys involucrata, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers surrounded by leaf-like bracts, giving it its common name. It thrives in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and sandy soils. Centrostachys involucrata is typically found in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico.
